item.title: Graph Signal Processing
item.description: Data indexed by graphs (aka networks) What do social, sensor, and biological networks have in common? Yes, they are networks (i.e., graphs) consisting of nodes (people, sensors, genes, whatever) connected by links. But there is more: Each node produces data, and data in nearby nodes is somewhat similar.
